trial_identification.studytitle: Swiss Ball Exercise versus Floor Exercise for patients with chronic low back pain: Effect on Trunk Muscle Endurance and Control of Lumbopelvic Posture
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Swiss Ball exercise versus floor exercise for patients with chronic low back pain: Effect on Trunk Muscle Endurance and Control of Lumbopelvic Posture

interventions.interventions: Swiss ball exercise group: Supervised exercise training using the Swiss ball, 45 minutes per session, 3 times/week for 8 weeks
interventions.comparator: Floor exercise group: Supervised floor-based exercise training, 45 minutes per session, 3 times/week for 8 weeks

primaryOutcome.timepoint: Assessed at baseline and within 7 days of completion of the intervention.
Assessed at baseline and within 7 days of completion of the intervention.

secondaryOutcome.timepoint: Administered at baseline and within 7 days of completion of the intervention.
Administered at baseline and within 7 days of completion of the intervention.
Administered at baseline and within 7 days of completion of the intervention.
Administered at baseline and within 7 days of completion of the intervention.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Non-specific low back pain with the current episode lasting for at least 3 months duration but no longer than one year and the pain is present for at least 50% of the time; expects to continue residing in the Illawara region for study duration.
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Suspected or confirmed serious spinal pathology; suspected or confirmed pregnancy; previous spinal surgery; scheduled for major surgery during treatment or follow-up period; high blood pressure; known cardiovascular disease.

trial_design.concealment: Allocation to group is done via sealed opaque envelopes
trial_design.sequence: Sequence generated by computer program. No stratification.

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The aim of this study is to compare the efficacy of two commonly used clinical exercise interventions for patients with chronic low pain; Swiss ball exercise and floor-based exercise. We hypothesise that there will be no difference between the two exercise programs in terms of improving trunk muscle endurance and lumbopelvic posture.
